intro: Atraphaxis virgata, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its tall, narrow leaves and striking white to yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, storing water in its thick, fleshy stems. Its flowers typically bloom in late spring or early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Atraphaxis virgata is often found in rocky soils and is a hardy species that thrives in low-nutrient conditions.
